item.title: Spider-Man 2 Developers Explain How PS5 Pro Elevates The Game's Visuals
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/spider-man-2-developers-explain-how-ps5-pro-elevates-the-games-visuals/1100-6527564/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Spider-Man 2 was already one of the best PlayStation 5 games when it was released last year, and it was a natural choice to be one of the first PS5 Pro-enhanced games. The question for players is whether those visual upgrades are worth the PlayStation 5 Pro's $700 price tag. That's why some of the developers behind Spider-Man 2 have contributed to a new video that shows off what the game looks like when run on the more powerful system.

"When players play Marvel Spider-Man 2 on PlayStation 5 Pro, they are playing the quintessential version of the Spider-Man experience on the PlayStation 5," said Insomniac Games creative director Bryan Intihar. As part of the demonstration, Intihar noted that players can send either Spider-Man swinging through New York at 60 frames per second without losing the clarity of graphics from the game's fidelity mode.

Senior art director Jacinda Chew added that Spider-Man 2 is filled with reflective surfaces, from water to the skyscraper windows, and even Spider-Man's goggles. Those are details that could easily be overlooked considering how much is happening on screen at any given moment in the game. With PS5 Pro, those reflections are much easier to notice and appreciate.

That still might not be enough to convince some players to make the leap to Sony's mid-generation update. But as far as Intihar is concerned, he's happy that players get to have the choice of how they want to play Spider-Man 2.

PlayStation 5 Pro will launch on November 7.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: CoD: Black Ops 6 Teaser Reveals New MP Maps For Season 1
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/cod-black-ops-6-teaser-reveals-new-mp-maps-for-season-1/1100-6527563/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty: Black Op 6 is getting its first seasonal update next month, and Activision has released a teaser trailer to showcase three of the new multiplayer maps coming to the game with Season 1.

The new Call of Duty trailer is very brief, but it shows off three standard core maps for Black Ops 6 multiplayer. The full teaser trailer can be viewed below.

Season 01 takes Black Ops to the the criminal underground on November 14.
Here's a sneak peek at a few of the new maps coming to #BlackOps6 Multiplayer this season üëá
üí∞ Hideout - 6v6
üöÅ Extraction - 6v6
üñºÔ∏è Heirloom - 6v6 & 2v2 pic.twitter.com/7RhjAmvQnh

‚Äî Call of Duty (@CallofDuty) November 4, 2024

Extraction is a 6v6 map that is set on a dock with boats and helipads, and Hideout is a 6v6 map that features clusters of small buildings and shipping crates. Heirloom is a map that takes place inside a museum of some kind, and this map will be available in 6v6 as well as 2v2 Gunfight.

Call of Duty Season 1 arrives on November 14. The big update will integrate Black Ops 6's content and game mechanics into Warzone, as well as add the new Area 99 Resurgence map. Zombies mode will also receive a new map sometime during in season.

Black Ops 6 recently added the popular Nuketown map to multiplayer, which includes a double-XP event that ends on November 5. The double-XP weekend was originally scheduled to end today, but Treyarch has extended the time after correcting an issue with the XP earn rates.

For more, you can check out GameSpot's Black Ops 6 campaign, multiplayer, and Zombies reviews.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Controversial Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 X-Ray Vision Perk Is In Treyarch's Crosshairs
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/controversial-call-of-duty-black-ops-6-x-ray-vision-perk-is-in-treyarch-crosshairs/1100-6527561/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A controversial ability in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is in the firing line, as Treyarch has confirmed that it's looking at nerfing the Recon three-perk bonus in the game. This perk allows players to see opposing players through walls for a brief period after they respawn and leaves no death skulls after successfully eliminating an enemy, provided they have the Vigilance, Engineer, and Ghost perks equipped.

FaZe's Swagg brought the issue to light on X/Twitter, to which associate director Matt Scronce offered a succinct one-word reply:

Black Ops 6 features a tighter map design in multiplayer that helps to emphasize the new Omni-movement system of this year's Call of Duty game, and with smaller arenas, the Recon-three perk provides a significant advantage to players who take advantage of it.

On social media platforms, numerous players were complaining about just how challenging it was to build up any momentum with seemingly clairvoyant opponents running around maps--fan-favorite map Nuketown has been seen as a prime example of this--making for a frustrating experience overall. However, players who discovered that flashbanging teammates to earn easy XP might also be compounding these issues.

Out now on PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X|S, and Xbox One, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 has had an especially good launch through Xbox Game Pass. Analysts looked at the data from the Call of Duty HQ app--which includes several other Call of Duty games--and found that 52% of active Xbox Series X|S users and 34% of active PS5 players dove into the game when it went live, leading to a "bonkers" day on Xbox consoles alone.

Looking ahead, players can prepare for Black Ops 6 Season 1 on November 14 and the debut of Call of Duty: Warzone's newest map, Area 99.

Darryn Bonthuys on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
